This is Graham Hovey with another Letter from Vitaly, datelined
Rom©, These programs are produced for the National Association of
Educational Broadcasters with the cooperation of Radio Italians,
It is one of my objectives in these Letters from Italy to fill
in some of the gaps left in the spot news coverage of this country
by the American press, periodicals and commercial radio networks,
one advantage of this kind of program should be that the writer can
afford to let the dust settle a bit and take a second, third of
fourth look at an event, or series of events, in the Interest of
gaining perspective.
I have permitted the dust to settle a bit on a series of incidents
that made a deep impression on me, I refer to the Rome student demon*
strations on the Trieste violence of early November; the demonstrations
of the 6th and 7th of November, including the masssive protest by
10,000 persons in front of the United States embassy.
These demonstrations were organised in protest over the killing
of a number of Italians by British*trained police during the Trieste
rioting. I should like to speak about them because some Intelligent
Italians believe they are directly related to a much broader question?
is Fascism on the way back in Italy!
I shall not attempt to answer that broader question. About all
a visiting journalist should do at this point, in ray opinion, is to
find out what Italians think about it.
Student demonstrations, of course, have long been a standard
feature of the European political scene. Some older European hands
may not have been as impressed as I was with the manifestations of
November 6 and 7.
